Context:
At George Brown College, individuals can register and pay for courses on a course-by-course basis, regardless of whether they are pursuing a credential (program) or not. Students can take multiple courses in a term if they choose. To complete a program and receive a credential from George Brown, students must finish the required courses within the given timeframe and request their certificate or other credential upon completion. For program-specific information, visit the Program Requirements webpage. If students want to earn a credential from an external body, they need to complete the necessary courses through George Brown and meet any additional requirements set by the external body, following the process outlined on the respective website.

George Brown College is situated on the traditional territory of the Mississaugas of the Credit First Nation and other Indigenous peoples. For more information about land acknowledgment, visit the college-wide website.

The information provided in this text may be subject to change without notice and should not be considered a representation, offer, or warranty. Students are advised to verify George Brown College fee requirements.
